Code Summary: The code implements an Attention Dual Convolutional-based Random Binary Kepler (ADC-RBK) model for predicting chronic disease risk, specifically targeting Alzheimer's disease detection. Data Types: MRI imaging data (specifically brain MRI scans for Alzheimer's detection)

Study Name: Alzheimer's Disease Cooperative Study Clinical Trials Dataset

Biomedical Relevance: YES - This repository is directly focused on stroke detection using brain imaging data (MRI and CT scans). It involves medical imaging analysis, neurological condition detection, and clinical decision support for brain disorders, making it highly relevant to biomedical research and healthcare applications.
Code Summary: This code implements a symmetry-aware AI system for detecting brain strokes from single CT and MRI slices using a hybrid expert-AI decision framework. The system preprocesses DICOM medical imaging data by normalizing pixel intensities, automatically separating different imaging sequences (T2, FLAIR, DWI, ADC), removing background noise, and applying quantized z-score mapping to highlight lesions. It combines multiple imaging sequences in a 3D analysis approach that mimics radiologist workflow and includes a validation layer for expert review.
Data Types: - MRI DICOM files (T2, T2 FLAIR, DWI b0, DWI b1000, ADC sequences) - CT DICOM files - Brain imaging slices - Normalized grayscale NumPy arrays - Lesion segmentation masks
Tooling: - DICOM processing capabilities - NumPy for array manipulation - CNN (Convolutional Neural Networks) for image analysis - Custom preprocessing algorithms for sequence separation - Z-score normalization and quantization methods - 3D multi-sequence integration framework

Code Summary: This project implements deep learning models for predicting Alzheimer's disease from brain MRI scans using transfer learning approaches. The code compares different CNN architectures including pretrained 2D AlexNet with 2D representation and 3D autoencoders, achieving 86% accuracy with the AlexNet approach on a dataset of 686 MRI scans from the ADNI study.

Code Summary: This repository implements the MIRAGE (MIxture model based Rare variant Analysis on GEnes) computational workflow for identifying rare genetic variants associated with Alzheimer's Disease using ADNI-1 data. The pipeline processes genetic data from 389 individuals (175 AD cases, 214 controls) through quality control, imputation, functional annotation, and gene-level association testing to identify rare variants with minor allele frequencies between 0.005-0.01 that may contribute to AD risk.

Biomedical Relevance: YES. This repository is directly focused on brain tumor segmentation using MRI data, which is a core biomedical application for neurological conditions. The project specifically addresses brain tumor analysis using medical imaging data and achieves state-of-the-art results on the BraTS (Brain Tumor Segmentation) dataset.
Code Summary: A4-Unet is a deep learning architecture for brain tumor segmentation that combines four advanced components: Deformable Large Kernel Attention (DLKA), Swin Spatial Pyramid Pooling (SSPP), Combined Attention Module (CAM), and Attention Gates (AG). The model addresses challenges in MRI brain tumor segmentation including irregular tumor shapes and unclear boundaries, achieving 94.4% Dice score on the BraTS 2020 dataset.
Data Types: MRI data including T1-weighted, T1-contrast enhanced, T2-weighted, and FLAIR sequences; segmentation masks; skin lesion data (ISIC dataset); hippocampus imaging data.
Tooling: Python 3.8+, PyTorch 1.8+, Swin Transformer, deformable convolutions, DCT (Discrete Cosine Transform), attention mechanisms, mixed precision training (AMP), AdamW optimizer, Jupyter notebooks for visualization.
